00025 //! Base class for spectrum solvers.
00026 //! \sa FFTSolver, MEMStrict, CompositeSpectrumSolver, FreqEstimation, MemBurg, YuleWalkerAR
00027 class SpectrumSolver {
00028 public:
00029     SpectrumSolver();
00030     virtual ~SpectrumSolver();
00031     
00032     //! Perform spectrum analysis.
00033     void exec(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memin, std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memout,
00034         int t0, double tol, FFT::twindowfunc windowfunc, double windowlength) throw (XKameError&);
00035     const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& ifft() const {return m_ifft;}
00036     //! \return (power, index) in descending order.
00037     const std::vector<std::pair<double, double> >& peaks() const {return m_peaks;}
00038     
00039     typedef double (*tfuncIC)(double sigma2, int p, int t);
00040 
00041     //! Akachi's information criterion.
00042     //! \arg loglikelifood ln(L).
00043     //! \arg k # of parameters.
00044     //! \arg n # of samples.
00045     static double icAIC(double loglikelifood, int k, int n);
00046     //! Corrected Akachi's information criterion.
00047     //! \sa icAIC
00048     static double icAICc(double loglikelifood, int k, int n);
00049     //! Hannan-Quinn information criterion.
00050     //! \sa icAIC
00051     static double icHQ(double loglikelifood, int k, int n); 
00052     //! Minimum Description Length.
00053     //! \sa icAIC
00054     static double icMDL(double loglikelifood, int k, int n);    
00055     
00056     static double windowLength(int tdlen, int t0, double windowlength);
00057 
00058     virtual bool isFT() const {return false;}
00059 protected:
00060     virtual void genSpectrum(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memin,
00061         std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memout,
00062         int t0, double tol, FFT::twindowfunc windowfunc, double windowlength) = 0;
00063     std::vector<std::complex<double> > m_ifft;
00064     std::vector<std::pair<double, double> > m_peaks;
00065     
00066     //! Create a window waveform.
00067     void window(int t, int t0, FFT::twindowfunc windowfunc,
00068         double windowlength, std::vector<double> &window);
00069     
00070     //! If false, perform rectangular windowing before solver process.
00071     virtual bool hasWeighting() const {return false;}
00072     
00073     //! \return estimated number of effective (noisy) data points.
00074     double numberOfNoises(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memin);
00075 
00076     void genIFFT(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& wavein);
00077     //! Least-square phase estimation.
00078     //! \return coeff.
00079     double lspe(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& wavein, int origin,
00080         const std::vector<double>& psd, std::vector<std::complex<double> >& waveout,
00081         double tol, bool powfit, FFT::twindowfunc windowfunc);
00082     //! \return err.
00083     double stepLSPE(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& wavein, int origin,
00084         const std::vector<double>& psd, std::vector<std::complex<double> >& waveout,
00085         bool powfit, double &coeff, const std::vector<double> &weight);
00086 
00087     shared_ptr<FFT> m_fftN, m_ifftN;
00088     int fftlen() const {return m_ifftN->length();}
00089     
00090     //! For autocorrelation.
00091     shared_ptr<FFT> m_fftRX, m_ifftRX;
00092     void autoCorrelation(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >&wave,
00093         std::vector<std::complex<double> >&corr);
00094 };
00095 
00096 //! Zero-filled FFT spectrum solver.
00097 class FFTSolver : public SpectrumSolver {
00098 public:
00099     FFTSolver() : SpectrumSolver()  {}
00100     virtual ~FFTSolver() {}
00101 protected:
00102     virtual void genSpectrum(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memin,
00103         std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memout,
00104         int t0, double tol, FFT::twindowfunc windowfunc, double windowlength);
00105     virtual bool hasWeighting() const {return true;}
00106     virtual bool isFT() const {return true;}
00107 };

00109 //! Extra-polation of data using MEM (Maximum Entropy Method) by assuming gaussian distribution.
00110 class MEMStrict : public SpectrumSolver {
00111 public:
00112     virtual ~MEMStrict();
00113 protected:
00114     virtual void genSpectrum(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memin,
00115         std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memout,
00116         int t0, double tol, FFT::twindowfunc windowfunc, double windowlength);
00117 private:
00118     void setup(unsigned int t, unsigned int n);
00119     double stepMEM(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memin, std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memout,
00120         double alpha, double sigma, int t0, double tol);
00121     void solveZ(double tol);
00122 
00123     std::vector<std::complex<double> > m_lambda, m_accumDY, m_accumDYFT;
00124     shared_ptr<FFT> m_fftT;
00125     std::vector<double> m_accumG2;
00126     double m_accumZ;
00127 };
00128 
00129 //! Perform two spectrum solvers.
00130 //! The preprocessor class \a T and postprocessor class \a X.
00131 //! \a T is for an extra-polation of data and/or rejection of noises.   
00132 template <class T, class X>
00133 class CompositeSpectrumSolver : public T {
00134 public:
00135 protected:
00136     virtual void genSpectrum(const std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memin,
00137         std::vector<std::complex<double> >& memout,
00138         int t0, double tol, FFT::twindowfunc windowfunc, double windowlength) {
00139         m_preprocessor.exec(memin, memout, t0, tol, windowfunc, windowlength);
00140         int t = memin.size();
00141         int n = memout.size();
00142         int t0a = t0;
00143         if(t0a < 0)
00144             t0a += (-t0a / n + 1) * n;
00145         std::vector<std::complex<double> > nsin(t);
00146         for(int i = 0; i < t; i++) {
00147             int j = (t0a + i) % n;
00148             nsin[i] = m_preprocessor.ifft()[j];
00149         }
00150         T::genSpectrum(nsin, memout, t0, tol, windowfunc, windowlength);
00151     }
00152     X m_preprocessor;
00153 };
00154
